Text.Value: Listen in on their conversation.
I bet a few coins would loosen your tongue. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
*The two men bark softly to each other. A single name reaches your ears: 'Nine-Fingers'.*
Hmm. Better you than me. Now listen - I'll only say this once:
Heh - he's got you there, Spoon.
Heh - she's got you there, Spoon.
Heh - they've got you there, Spoon.
The new kingpin? All meat and muscle, that one. And wild as a werebear. If he's looking to oust Nine-Fingers, my blade's got his back.
Talking about Nine-Fingers? I've got business with her.
I need work, and it sounds like Nine-Fingers needs steel.
Mind if I join you?
Now cut out. This here's a private function.
Leave.
Nice - I promise I'll put it to good use.
Now scram. The chat's officially closed.
Good luck with that, chum. My mouth's buttoned.
Nine-Fingers won't be happy about Zenovia. And I'm not about to tell her.
And? You're airing private matters in a brothel.
Damn right I do.

EditorData.stateContext: Both characters are sitting on chairs at the table facing each other.

Text.Value: All the dwarf sellouts I know would disagree.
Oh yeah? Seems everyone's got business with her. Heard the gal met her match.
Sounds messy as the ninth hell. Must be why she called us to help.
I need to talk to Nine-Fingers about Zenovia.
Attack.
Read the dwarf's mind.
And I'm short on patience.
Hey, you still lurking about? I don't remember inviting you to the party.
My tongue's not for sale. Now scram - this conversation's done, over, finished.
Stick my neck out for a duergar? Not happening.
And risk my neck? I don't think so.
I'm short on gold, I'm afraid.
Leave.
Is that right? The way I heard it, you Zhent cut a deal with the new... hold on.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Borgus, but then noticing player is listening in

Text.Value: Don't matter - this discussion doesn't concern you. So why don't you make tracks?
Lower City. Basilisk Gate. Guildhall. And that's all you're getting from me.
Dammit!
Now, this subject's not safe, so listen close - I'm only saying it once:
*It's a name you know. Nine-Fingers is the head of the Guild, a criminal organisation operating inside Baldur's Gate.*
*No matter how hard you concentrate, you can make no sense of their conversation.*
Look - this subject's not safe. You selling your services, beat feet to the Guild hall.
I'm looking to join the Guild. How about you point me the way?
Leave.
Come on, level with me. I'm not about to sell out another dwarf.
You Rats with the Guild now? Heard Nine-Fingers met her match.
Here you are, then.
Hey Borgus - this snooper's up in my brain. Time he learns a thing or two!
Hey Borgus - this snooper's up in my brain. Time she learns a thing or two!
Hey Borgus - this snooper's up in my brain. Time they learn a thing or two!
You there - getting up in our affairs?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player, who is caught eavedropping

Text.Value: Don't know who you're talking about. So clear out, hm?
Sounds like an interesting business. I'd like to take part.
Now you're speaking my language.

Synopsis: Boasting crooks threeway dialog. Earspoon, a Rivington Rat, and Borgus, a Zhentarim smuggler, are chatting over dice.
